parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From psallo; a set piece of music, i.e. A sacred ode; collectively, the book of the Psalms.
A hymn, sacred song, song of praise to God. Apparently from a simpler form of hudeo; a 'hymn' or religious ode.
Spiritual. From pneuma; non-carnal, i.e. ethereal, or a spirit, or supernatural, regenerate, religious.
An ode, song, hymn. From aido; a chant or 'ode'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Probably strengthened from psao; to twitch or twang, i.e. To play on a stringed instrument.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
